mean_en: a feeling or belief that something is going to happen when there is no definite reason to believe it will
word_etyma: pre预先+monit警告+ion名词后缀 → premonition预感
short_phrase: have a premonition about the future
sentence: I have a weird premonition this isn't going to go well.
sentence_trans: 我有个奇怪的预感：这件事不会顺利。
